title: Ways to Easily Find the Administrator of a Facebook Page

steps.title: Go to the About section and look through the provided information.
steps.content: Go to the About section and look through the provided information. Once you're on the Facebook Page, click on the "About" tab located in the left menu bar. [1] X Research source If you're using the mobile app, tap the “About” tab located in the menu bar underneath the header. “About” is directly to the right of “Home.” [2] X Research source In this About section, a Page may list various contact and business information such as an email, a website address, the founders of the company, and the business overview. [3] X Research source You may need to click or tap See all under "Members" to see the "Admins & moderators" section. Keep in mind that a Page is not obligated to provide this information. Therefore, it may be a bit harder to find the Admin if there is less visible information. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Send a message.
steps.content: Send a message. Another way to find the Admin is to simply ask them yourself by sending a message through Facebook. To do this, click/tap the Message button on the Page. This will either appear as a blue button labeled “Send Message,” or as a smaller gray button with the Facebook Messenger icon (shaped like a speech bubble). [5] X Research source On both the website and mobile app, this button will be located directly underneath the Page title. Keep in mind that sending a message uses Facebook Messenger , so you will be redirected to the Facebook Messenger app if you are using a mobile phone.

steps.title: Go to the Page in question.
steps.content: Go to the Page in question. Once logged into your Facebook account, you can navigate to the Page using your Shortcuts or by finding it on your Feed .

steps.title: Click Settings (if you can).
steps.content: Click Settings (if you can). If you see the "Settings" option, but it's greyed out, you don't have access to change the Page, but you have some privileges to moderate the page, including comments. If you can click "Settings," you have editing permissions for the Page.

steps.title: Click your profile picture.
steps.content: Click your profile picture. You need to be logged into the Page's account on Facebook in order to check who has admin rights on your Page.

steps.title: Click Settings & privacy.
steps.content: Click Settings & privacy . It's next to an icon of a gear.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . It's the first option on the menu.

steps.title: Click Page setup.
steps.content: Click Page setup . You'll see this option in the menu on the left side of your window next to an icon of a flag.

steps.title: Click Page access.
steps.content: Click Page access . This will show you everyone who manages your Page. [6] X Research source If users are missing that you are sure were here, they will be removed from this list if their FB account is closed or deactivated.
